Now Leasing Affordable Senior Apartments in the Bronx We are currently accepting applications for brand-new affordable apartments through the Project-Based Voucher (PBV) Section 8 Program. This community has been designed with comfort, accessibility, and long-term affordability in mind. Program & Eligibility These apartments are reserved for individuals or households where at least one member is age 62 or older at the time of application. Eligibility is determined by both age and household size, as well as income limits. Applicants must qualify for Section 8 housing assistance. Rent is calculated at 30% of household income, as determined by Section 8 guidelines, and includes utilities. Maximum annual household income to apply: $56,700. This building is part of the Senior Affordable Rental Apartments (SARA) Program and supported through the HOME Investment Partnerships Program (HOME) of the New York City Department of Housing Preservation and Development. What You‚Äôll Need to Apply While requirements may vary from household to household, applicants should be prepared to provide: Proof of income for all household members Valid identification for each resident Documentation verifying household size and eligibility No application fees or deposits are required Applicants selected will also undergo program verification to confirm Section 8 eligibility. Advantages & Amenities This thoughtfully designed building provides a safe, welcoming, and convenient environment for seniors. Prospective new tenants who meet the income requirements can apply to join the wait list. Qualified applicants will have the opportunity to lease rent stabilized apartments that are in the re-rental pool. The lottery is run in cooperation with TF Cornerstone, the NYC Housing Development Corporation (HDC), and the NYC Department of Housing Preservation and Development (HPD). Actual rent may vary based on lease terms. A 3% increase for one-year leases commencing on or after October 1, 2025, and on or before September 30, 2026, and 4.5% increase for a two-year lease commencing on or after October 1, 2025, and on or before September 30, 2026. FAQ General Questions What is affordable housing and how does it work? Through Housing Connect, you can find and apply for affordable rental and homeownership opportunities. To qualify, your household must meet the income and size requirements for a unit in the affordable development. Your household is all of the people who will live in the affordable unit. Housing is considered affordable if it costs about one-third or less of what the people living there get in income. The New York City Department of Housing Preservation and Development (HPD) and Housing Development Corporation (HDC) create affordable housing opportunities for many household income levels and sizes. The buildings are privately owned. HPD and HDC have a monitoring and oversight role. Application Questions I can‚Äôt find my verification code. Housing Connect uses two-step verification for creating your account. Your Housing Connect verification code is sent to a different email (or phone number) than your confirmation email. Check the email address or phone number that you entered as your additional contact info when you signed up. If you‚Äôre still having trouble, check out the Housing Connect training video titled ‚ÄòAccount Setup‚Äô. Where do I apply for new buildings availabilities instead of re-rentals? Online: Apply online through Housing Connect when the lottery opens. For detailed instructions, review the Housing Connect Guidebook. By mail: Paper applications can be requested. The address to request a paper application will be updated once the lottery has officially launched. Where do I enter my information? After you have created your account, you can view, add, and edit your information from the ‚ÄúMy Household‚Äù page. After logging in, you‚Äôll see your name with an arrow next to it in the top right-hand corner of the page. Click your name, and a dropdown menu will appear. Click the ‚ÄúMy Household‚Äù option. This page shows your Household Summary, Household Members, and Housing Choices. Click the light grey ‚ÄúEdit‚Äù buttons on the right of each section to add your information. For detailed instructions, see How to Apply. The website is not working and I can‚Äôt apply. If you‚Äôre still having trouble after reviewing the Applying Online instructions and Housing Connect Training videos, you may want to apply by mail. What happens after you apply? It can take several months or longer to hear about your application. Sometimes you might not hear back even if you qualify. While you‚Äôre waiting, carefully check what your current lease says about moving out before the lease is over. If you‚Äôre offered an apartment, you might need to move quickly. What are my next steps after I apply? If your application is selected, you‚Äôll be invited to respond to a document request. This interview is very important. Agents from the building will confirm if you qualify for the opportunity you applied for. Get ready ahead of time to make sure you‚Äôre prepared. What if I never hear back? If you aren‚Äôt selected or don‚Äôt hear back, keep searching for other apartments and apply when you are ready.
